0: Damascus Township, Wayne County- As students returned to class at Damascus Elementary School Tuesday, there was one face missing. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Fifth grader Tristen Kurilla, who is 10 years old, is in the Wayne County prison facing a criminal homicide charge. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He is charged as an adult, the only way allowed by law according to district attorney Janine Edwards. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "Under Pennsylvania law it is mandatory, it is not discretionary that a criminal homicide charge be first directly filed in adult court by the prosecutor regardless of the age of the perpetrator" said D.A. Edwards NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR On Saturday, state police say the 10-year-old came up behind 90-year-old Helen Novak while she was sitting on a bed at this home on SkyLake Road in Damascus Township. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Kurilla is accused of choking her for several seconds with a walking stick and then punching her at least five times in the throat. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "Tristen really kind of doesn't have an idea of what is going on" said Attorney Bernie Brown who will represent the 10-year-old. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He has filed a bail petition to get the boy out of prison. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "Jail is still jail, no matter what part of the facility you are in" said Brown NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The crime, the arrest and the charges have stunned this normally quiet part of northeastern Pennsylvania. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "That's pretty shocking. Ive never heard of that before...but wow" said Walter Yanacek of Damascus Township. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "It is unbelievable at that age, well, any age but 10 years old!" said Harold Greaves of Damascus Township NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "it's a shame. I hope the kid gets help and the family gets help" noted David Price of Tyler Hill NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Police and prosecutors say by putting Kurilla in prison, they are just following the law, because they say juvenile detention centers will not accept a child charged with homicide NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR SOT: Janine Edwards NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Wayne County District Attorney NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "it is not a choice I made, it's not a choice the warden made, it's not a choice Pennsylvania State Police made" NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR say
